utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh Monica that was the best Thanksgiving dinner ever! I think you killed us.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I couldn't possibly eat another bite.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I need something sweet.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Does anyone wanna watch TV?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Yeah, sure.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Monica your remote doesn't work.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Phoebe, you have to lift it and point.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh. Aw, forget it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, you know what we should all do? We should play that game where everyone says one thing that they're thankful for.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ooh-ooh, I! I am thankful for this beautiful fall we've been having.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That's very nice.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That's sweet, Joey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, the other day I was at the bus-stop and this lovely fall breeze came in out of nowhere and blew this chick's skirt right up. Oh! Which reminds me, I'm also thankful for thongs.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I mean, it's not so much an underpant as it is a feat of engineering. I mean, it's amazing how much they can do with so little material! And the way they play with your mind! Is it there? Is it not there?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Are you aware that you're still talking?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Is anyone thankful for anything else besides a thong?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Huh, I don't know what to pick. Am I more thankful for my divorce or my eviction? Hmm.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow! See, and I didn't think you'd be able to come up with anything.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'm sorry. It's just that this is the worse Thanksgiving ever.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No-no-no! I am the king of bad Thanksgivings. You can't just swoop in here with your bad marriage and take that away from me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, you're not gonna tell the whole story about how your parents got divorced again are you?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh God, no.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, come on! I wanna hear it! It wouldn't be Thanksgiving without Chandler bumming us out!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It's a tradition, like the parade. If the parade decided it was gay, moved out, and abandoned its entire family.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Bing
utterance.content: Now Chandler dear, just because your father and I are getting a divorce it doesn't mean we don't love you. It just means he would rather sleep with the house-boy than me.

utterance.speaker: The Housekeeper
utterance.content: More turkey Mr. Chandler?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You're right. Yours is worse. You are the king of bad Thanksgivings.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I don't know about that. I've got one that's worse.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Really? Worse than, "More turkey Mr. Chandler?"

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, did the little rich boy have a problem with the butler? Yes, mine's worse!

utterance.speaker: Past Life Phoebe
utterance.content: More bandages! More bandages! Please, can I get some more bandages in here! This man is dying— Oh no.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: In this life, Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, this life! Oh okay no, Chandler's is worse.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Man, it must be so cool remembering stuff like that! I don't have any past life memories.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Of course you don't sweetie. You're brand new.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know Monica's worst Thanksgiving.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, let's not tell this story.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Oh, come on!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh no, I know! I know! It's the one where Joey got Monica's turkey stuck on his head!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?! Joey got a turkey stuck on his head?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, it's not like it sounds.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It's exactly like it sounds.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Phoebe?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Joey? What's going on?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I know! It's stuck!!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Easy. Step. How did it get on?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I put it on to scare Chandler!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God! Monica's gonna totally freak out!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well then help me get it off! Plus, it smells really bad in here.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, of course it smells really bad. You have your head up a dead animal.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, did you get the turkey basted—Oh my God! Oh my God! Who is that?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It's Joey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What-what are you doing? Is this supposed to be funny?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, it's not supposed to be funny, it's supposed to be scary.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, get it off now!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I can't! It-it's stuck!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, I don't care! That-that turkey has to feed 20 people at my parent's house and they're not gonna eat it off your head!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right, hold on! Okay, let's just all think.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, I got it. Phoebe? All right, you pull. I'm gonna spread the legs as wide as I can. Joey? Now is not the time!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Sorry! Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, count to three. 1. 2. 3!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Arghhhhhh!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It worked! I scared ya, I knew it! Ha-ha!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'm over here big guy.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, you are! I scared you!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You did look like an idiot.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, I wasn't the only one who looked like an idiot. All right? Remember when Ross tried to say, "Butternut squash?" And it came out, "Squatternut buash?"

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah that's the same.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That's it. That's my worse Thanksgiving.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh wait! That can't be the one Rachel's talking about. She didn't even know that happened. So which one was it?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Which one?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Umm, I-I really don't want to tell this story.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, come on Monica, reliving past pain and getting depressed is what Thanksgiving is all about. Y'know, for me anyway. And of course, the Indians.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Look umm, of all people, you do not want me to tell this story!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Monica! I think Rachel's here!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I'll get it! Happy Thanksgiving!

utterance.speaker: Big Nosed Rachel
utterance.content: Not for me. Chip and I broke up!

utterance.speaker: Fat Monica
utterance.content: Oh, why? Why? What happened?

utterance.speaker: Big Nosed Rachel
utterance.content: Well, you know that my parents are out of town and Chip was going to come over…

utterance.speaker: Fat Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, and you were going him y'know, your flower.

utterance.speaker: Big Nosed Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, Monica, can you just call it sex?! It really creeps me out when you call it that! Okay, and by the way, while we're at it, a guy's thing is not called his tenderness. Believe me! Hi!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Hi Rachel!

utterance.speaker: Big Nosed Rachel
utterance.content: Happy Thanksgiving!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: You too sweethart!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Oh my!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh, everyone, this is Chandler! My roommate and lead singer of our band!

utterance.speaker: Fat Monica
utterance.content: Ross!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, this is Monica.

utterance.speaker: Fat Monica
utterance.content: Hi, I'm Ross's little sister.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: I'm so glad you could come Chandler, we've got plenty of food so I hope you're hungry.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, mom. Mom. Chandler hates Thanksgiving and doesn't eat any Thanksgiving food.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Oh, well, I'm so glad you brought him here then.

utterance.speaker: Fat Monica
utterance.content: Umm, Chandler, if you want I can make you some macaroni and cheese for dinner.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, as long as the pilgrims didn't eat it, I'm in.

utterance.speaker: Fat Monica
utterance.content: dammit!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So uh, Rach? Does it, does it feel weird around here now? Y'know since I've been away at college.

utterance.speaker: Big Nosed Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! No, not really.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, that's cool. So did…

utterance.speaker: Big Nosed Rachel
utterance.content: Ugh! I cannot believe Chip dumped me for that slut Nancy Branson. I am never going out with him again. I don't care how much he begs!

utterance.speaker: Fat Monica
utterance.content: I think his begging days are over now that he's going out with Nancy Branson.

utterance.speaker: Big Nosed Rachel
utterance.content: Y'know what? I've just had it with high school boys! They are just silly. Silly, stupid boys! I'm going to start dating men!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Umm, I'm sorry Judy, I couldn't find that bowl that you and Jack were looking for.

utterance.speaker: Fat Monica
utterance.content: Call them mom and dad you loser!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Monica!

utterance.speaker: Fat Monica
utterance.content: Hey Chandler! Did you like the macaroni and cheese?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yeah, it was great. You should be a chef.

utterance.speaker: Fat Monica
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Big Nosed Rachel
utterance.content: Guess what?! All that stuff about Nancy Branson being a slut was all a rumor so Chip dumped her and he wants to come over to my house tonight!

utterance.speaker: Fat Monica
utterance.content: Oh that's so great!

utterance.speaker: Big Nosed Rachel
utterance.content: I know!

utterance.speaker: Fat Monica
utterance.content: Oh gosh, listen if you and Chip do it tonight, promise me you'll tell me everything.

utterance.speaker: Big Nosed Rachel
utterance.content: Oh totally, totally. Y'know it's not that big of deal, we already kinda did it once y'know.

utterance.speaker: Fat Monica
utterance.content: I know, but y'know, this time you're gonna definitely know whether or not you did it!

utterance.speaker: Big Nosed Rachel
utterance.content: I know, I know. And oh, and this time Chip promised that-that this time it will last at least for an entire song!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So I’m thinking about asking Rachel out tonight. Y'know maybe play her that song we wrote last week.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Emotional Knapsack?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Right on! Oh! Uh, but, don’t take to long okay? 'Cause uh, we're gonna test out our fake ID's tonight, right Clifford Alverez.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Listen, Roland Chang, if things go well, I’m gonna be out with her all night.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Dude, don't do that too me!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right, it's cool you can stay here. My parents won't mind.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, it's not that, I just don't want to be stuck here all night with your fat sister.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Monica, why don't you finish off these pies? I don't have any more room left in the fridge.

utterance.speaker: Fat Monica
utterance.content: No. No, thank you!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Well Judy, you did it! She's finally full!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I called you fat?! I don't even remember that!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, I do.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I am so sorry. I really am. I was an idiot back then. I rushed the stage at a Wham concert for crying out loud!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, I can't believe you called her fat.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I can't believe you let George Michael slap you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I am really sorry. That is so terrible. I am so, so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Actually, y'know that's not the Thanksgiving I was talking about.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yes, it was!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, it wasn't. It was actually the…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, now Thanksgiving's over, let's get ready for Christmas. Who wants to go get a Christmas tree?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, no, I have the cutest Christmas story!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We wanna hear Monica's Thanksgiving story!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Fine, all right, mine had a dwarf that got broke in half, but y'know whatever.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: So Rachel, your mom tells me you changed your major again.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, I had too. There was never any parking by the Psychology building.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Hi Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh hi!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Wow, love your new nose!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Jack.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: What? Dr. Wilson's an artist! He removed my mole cluster. Wanna see?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: I'll get it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, God! Please, let me!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey. Happy Thanksgiving!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: God, your hair sure is different!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, we were just talking about that. I can't believe how stupid we used to look.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So uh, where's Monica?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: She's upstairs. Monica! Come down! Everyone's here! Ross, Rachel, and the boy who hates Thanksgiving.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi, Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What-what's the matter? Is there, is there something on my dress?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You just, you look so different! Terrific! That dress! That body!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Dude!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Sorry!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Yes, yes Monica is thin. It's wonderful. But what we really want to hear about is Ross's new girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh mom! Okay, umm, her name is Carol. And she's really pretty. And smart. And uh, she's-she's on the lacrosse team and the golf team. Can you believe it? She plays for both teams!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So Chandler, I guess I'll see you at dinner.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Dude!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh-ho, my God! That was so awesome! You totally got him back for calling you fat! He was just drooling all over you. That must've felt so great!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well it didn't!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, I mean yeah, I look great. Yeah, I feel great and yeah, my heart is not in trouble anymore! Blah, blah, blah! Y'know I still don't feel like I got him back, y'know? I just want to humiliate him. I wanna, I want him to be like naked and then I'm going to point at him and laugh!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, that we may be able to do.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well guys tend to get naked before they're gonna have sex.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?! I mean, I didn't work this hard and-and-and lose all this weight so that I can give my flower to someone like him!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, first of all, if you keep calling it that, no one's gonna ever take it. Then, second of all you're not actually gonna have sex with him! You're just gonna make him think that you are.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: And when he's naked I can throw him out in the front yard and lock the door and all the neighbors will just humiliate him!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Then, you will definitely get him back!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, so how do I make him think I wanna have sex with him?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, oh, here's what you do. Just act like everything around you turns you on.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, like anything can be sexy. Like umm, oh-oh, like this dishtowel! Ooh, ooh, this feels sooo good against my cheek! And-and if I feel a little hot, I can just dab myself with it. Or I can bring it down to my side and bring it through my fingers while I talk to him.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I can do that!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah? Okay! Good, good, because he's coming. He's coming. Hey, what's up?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Monica, I was wondering if you can make me some of that righteous mac and cheese like last year.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Umm, I'd love too! Ooh, I love macaroni and cheese. I love-I love the way this box feels against my cheek.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Boy, I love carrots! Oh! Sometimes I like to put them between my fingers like this and-and hold them down here while I talk to you. Umm, and-and-and y'know if I get really hot umm, I-I like to pick up this knife and-and umm, I-I put the cold steal against umm, my body.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Are you all right?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh yeah, of course. I'm fine it's just that—

utterance.speaker: The Doctor
utterance.content: What do we got here?

utterance.speaker: The Paramedic
utterance.content: Twenty year old has got a severed toe on his right foot.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Can you please not do that feet first? You know where his injury is! Severed toe, you just said it!

utterance.speaker: The Doctor
utterance.content: It says here that the knife went right through your shoe.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Of course it did. They're made of wicker.

utterance.speaker: The Doctor
utterance.content: Did you bring the toe?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh yes! I have it right here, on ice!

utterance.speaker: The Doctor
utterance.content: Don't worry son, we'll just attach it and—

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?! What is it?

utterance.speaker: The Doctor
utterance.content: You brought a carrot.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: The Doctor
utterance.content: This isn't your toe, this is a small, very cold piece of carrot.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You brought a carrot?!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Oh my God! There's a toe in my kitchen.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: God, I'm sorry! I'll go back and get it!

utterance.speaker: The Doctor
utterance.content: It's too late, all we can do now is sow up the wound.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Without my toe?! I need my toe!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wait, no-no-no, I can go really fast! Dad, give me the keys to your Porsche!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Oh, I'm not falling for that one!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That's why I lost my toe?! Because I called you fat?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I didn't mean to cut it off. It was an accident.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That's why for an entire year people called me Sir Limps-A-Lot?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I'm sorry! It wasn't your whole toe!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, well, I miss the tip! It's the best part. It has the nail.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chandler!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Sir Limps-A-Lot, I came up with that.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You're a dork.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I can't believe this.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chandler, I said I was sorry.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, well, sorry doesn’t bring back the little piggy that cried all the way home! I hate this stupid day! And everything about it! I'll see you later.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh wait, Chandler, come here is there anything I can do? Anything?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, just leave me alone for a while.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh-oh, I'm a duck! I go, "Quack, quack!" I’m happy all the time!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Nice try.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wait, wait, wait!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look, Monica…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Look!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: This is not going to work.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I bet this will work!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You are so great! I love you!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Nothing! I said, I said "You're so great" and then I just, I just stopped talking!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You said you loved me! I can't believe this!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No I didn't!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yes, you did!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No I didn't!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You love me!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No I don't! Stop it! Stop it! Stop it! Stop it!

utterance.speaker: French Phoebe
utterance.content: Gauze! Gauze! I need to get some gauze in here! Can I please get some gauze in here! Whew! This is getting ridiculous uh!
